content: helix striped hat size small - baby medium - child yarn 2 colors vanna s choice yarn or similar aran weight main color mc / contrast color cc needles us size 9 double pointed magic loop or 2 circular gauge 16 stitches & 24 row = 4 notes these hats do not require a large amount of yardage you can make multiple hats with 2 full skeins or use up half ball leftovers the small uses approx 65 yards the medium uses approx 75 yards total you will use slightly more of the main color the baby sized hat is slightly too small to comfortably fit on a 16 circular needle choose the method you are comfortable with dpn magic loop or 2 circs from the beginning of the hat the child sized hat can comfortably fit on a 16 needle until you begin the decreases at that point switch to your preferred method this hat is knit utilizing the helix stripe each stripe is one row deep do not twist your yarn at the beginning of the round when you switch to the next color © corrie purdum this pattern is for personal use only key mc main color cc contrast color k knit p purl k2tog knit 2 together pm place marker pattern -in mc loosely cast on 54 66 stitches join in the round being careful not to twist pm to indicate beginning of round -row 1 6 k1 p1 to end of the row -row 7 knit 1 row -row 8 join cc and knit 1 row -row 9 knit 1 row in mc -row 10 knit 1 row in cc -repeat row 9 & 10 until hat length is 5 5 ½ © corrie purdum this pattern is for personal use only crown shaping continue to knit 1 row of mc and 1 row of cc throughout the crown -crown row 1 knit 7 9 k2tog pm 6 times -crown row 2 knit -crown row 3 knit until 2 stitches before marker k2tog 6 times -crown row 4 knit -repeat row 3 & 4 once more then continue with row 3 until 12 stitches remain -break yarn and thread through remaining stitches finishing weave in ends add optional braids or pom poms © corrie purdum this pattern is for personal use only
